data.title: Herald-Times-Reporter from Manitowoc, Wisconsin
data.meta_description: Get this Herald-Times-Reporter page for free from Tuesday, April 23, 2002 HERALD TIMES REPORTER Tuesday, April 23, OBITUARIES John H. Wilda John H. Wilda, of St.. Edition of Herald-Times-Reporter
data.text:
HERALD TIMES REPORTER Tuesday, April 23, OBITUARIES John H. Wilda John H. Wilda, of St. Mary's Home in Manitowoc, formerly of 2228 La Follette Manitowoc, died Sunday, April 21, 2002 at St. Mary's Home .

As his requests were, there will be no funeral services or visitation. Cremation will take place with burial of the cremains at Evergreen Cemetery in Manitowoc. John was born July 25, 1916 in Manitowoc, son of the late Henry and Blanche Kraijnik Wilda. He was a graduate of Lincoln High School with the class of 1934. He served with the United States Army with the 740th tank battalion overseas during World War II .

He owned and operated John H. Wilda Sales and Advertising here in married Lucille Klein in April 1952 in Milwaukee. She preceded John in death Feb. 19, 1982. John was a member of the American Legion Drews Bleser Post, Disabled American Veterans, Eagles Aerie and the Travelers Protection Association .

Survivors include one son: John W. Wilda, Manitowoc, along with other relatives and friends. He was preceded in death by his parents and his wife: Lucille in 1982. The Harrigan Parkside Funeral Home and Cremation Center, 628 N. Water Manitowoc, is assisting the family with funeral arrangements .

Herald Times Reporter Manitowoc for 45 years. He April 23, 2002 Vivian D. Galli Vivian D. Galli, age 83, a resident of St. Mary's Home, Manitowoc, died Friday afternoon April 19, 2002 at the home .

Funeral services will be held at 9 a.m. Thursday, April 25, 2002, at St. Mary's Home Chapel, Manitowoc. Officiating at the Mass of Christian Burial will be the Rev. Thomas Wojciechowski O.F.M .

with burial to follow in Calvary Cemetery, Manitowoc. Vivian was born on May 31, 1918 in Manitowoc, the daugh-. ter of the late Louis and Frances Mareschie Wagner. She graduated from Manitowoc Lincoln High School, class of 1936. She was preceded in death by her husbands: Anton Khail, Alois Novak and Fred Galli .

She was employed with the Mirro Aluminum Goods of Manitowoc and then as a nurse's aid with the Shady Lane Home for 30 years, retiring in 1984. Survivors include one son and daughter-in-law: Ronald and Pat Khail, Manitowoc; one stepdaughter and son-in-law: Gina and Steve Srenaski, Madison: one stepson and daughter-in-law: Lon and Sandy Galli, Myrtle Beach, S.C.; seven grandchildren; eight great-grandchildren and four great-great-grandchildren. She is further survived by nieces, nephews, other relatives and friends. Vivian was preceded in death by a son: Robert; two brothers and two sisters. The family will greet relatives and friends from 8 a.m .

Thursday until the time of service at 9 a.m. at St. Mary's Home Chapel, Manitowoc. The Pfeffer Funeral Home and Cremation Care Center, Manitowoc, is assisting the family with funeral arrangements. Herald Times Reporter April 23, 2002 Leonard J .

Sladky Funeral services for Leonard J. Sladky, age 78, of 509 Forest Home Drive, Francis Creek, who died early Sunday, April 21, 2002 at his residence will be held at noon on Wednesday, April 24, 2002 at St. Anne's Catholic Church, Francis Creek. The Mass.of Christian Burial will be concelebrated by the Rev. Theodore Hendricks and the Rev .

David Hoffman, with burial to follow in St. Anne's Parish Cemetery, Francis Creek. Friends may call at St. Anne's Catholic Church on Wednesday after 10 a.m. until the time of Mass at noon .

There will be no visitation this evening. Deja Martin Funeral Chapels, Two Rivers, is assisting the Sladky family with funeral arrangements. Herald Times Reporter April 23, 2002 Vetania L. Komorowski Vetania Leah Komorowski, age 22, of 1218 S. Seventh Manitowoc, died Saturday, April 20, 2002 as a result of an automobile accident .

Funeral services will be held at 7 p.m. Tuesday, April 23, 2002 (TODAY) at Hope Community Church, 4408 CTH at Hwy 310, Manitowoc. The Rev. Rick Hines will officiate with burial at Branch Evergreen Cemetery on BIRTHS HOLY FAMILY MEMORIAL MEDICAL CENTER Kimberly Wiesner, Manitowoc, son, Brandon Alexander, April 17. Road rage incident leads to charges Michael J. Kane Michael Francis (Frank) Scheuer Michael J .

Kane, age 78, town of Ledgeview, passed away peacefully after an extended illness Sunday, April 21, 2002. He was born April 8, 1924 in Stark to Michael and Elizabeth (Long) Kane. Michael married Katherine Rukamp on May 26, 1945 at St. Phillip's Catholic Church, Green Bay. He was a livestock dealer for many years .

He also enjoyed old tractors, machinery, farm auctions, country drives, and especially his afternoon nap. Michael had a great love for family, his wife, children and had a special place for his grandchildren and great grandchildren. He is survived by his wife of 56 years: Katherine; four sons: Darrell, Leonard, Scott, Kevin (Julie); one daughter: Jolene (Randy) Boehm; 15 grandchildren: Ryan, Jesse, Tammy, Michael, Tara, Korey, Christopher, Melissa, Adam, Caleb, Jacob, Caitlin, Scott, Aaron and Michelle; eight greatgrandchildren; two sisters: Elizabeth Denor and Agatha Linsmeir; three brothers: Giles, Gordon and John; numerous other nieces and nephews. Michael was preceded in death by his parents and two brothers: Jerome, and Charles. Friends may call on Wednesday April 24, 2002 from 4 to 9 p.m .

at Cotter Funeral Home, 860. N. Webster I De Pere. Parish prayer service will be 8:30 p.m. Francis (Frank) Francis (Frank) Scheuer, age 76, of 527 Elizabeth Mishicot, died early Monday morning, April 22, 2002 at the Holy Family Memorial Medical Center in Manitowoc .

Mass of Christian Burial will be held at 11 a.m. on Thursday, April 25, 2002 at Holy Cross Catholic Church in Mishicot, with the Rev. John Neuser officiating. Entombment will take place in the Knollwood Mausoleum in the town of Kossuth with military services accorded by the Mishicot VFW Kempen-Staudinger-Terens Post Frank was born Feb. 15, 1926 in Kaukauna, to the late Irvin and Gertrude Hoff Scheuer and has been a longtime area resident .

He was a graduate of the Mishicot High School with the class of 1944. Frank served his country in the United States Navy from 1946 to 1948. Frank married the former Mary Haen on Nov. 22, 1956 at St. Mary's Catholic Church in Greenleaf .

He owned and operated Frank Scheuer Retinning Mishicot until his retirement in 1974. He later worked as the custodian for the Holy Cross Parish in Mishicot from 1974 to 1988. Frank was a member of Holy Cross Catholic Church and was also a member of the Mishicot VFW Kempen-Staudinger-Terens Post Survivors include his wife: Mary; his children: James and Jeffer Scheuer of Owen; Thomas Scheuer of Mishicot; Jean and Neil Hopka of Two Rivers; Daniel Scheuer of Mishicot; David and Betsy Scheuer of Maribel; Marie and Kevin Steeber of Mishicot; MICHAEL J. KANE Visitation will continue on Thursday, April 25, 2002 from 8:30 a.m. at the funeral home until the cortege leaves for church .

Mass of Christian Burial will be Thursday, April 25, 2002 10:30 a.m. at St. Mary Catholic Church, Glenmore with the Rev. Lee J. Kahrs officiating .

Interment will be in the Allouez Cemetery. Michael's family would like to extend a special thank you to Dr. Wampler, Dr. Saphner, Dr. Alvardo, and Unity Hospice for the care and compassion they gave him during his illness .

Herald Times Reporter April 23, 2002 Joseph and Kelly Scheuer of Mishicot; Rita and Robert Lee of Tomahawk; and four grandchildren: Michael Steeber, John and Grace Scheuer and Kathryn Lee. He is also survived by his sisters and brothers-in-law: Maxine Juckem of Manitowoc; Jeanette Hansen of Two Rivers; Kathleen and Vernon Pautz of Mishicot; Joan and Lloyd Brouchoud of Mishicot; his brothers and sister-inlaw: Patrick and Darlene (Dolly) Scheuer of Mishicot; and Michael Scheuer of Mishicot. Frank is further survived by his brothers-in-law and sisters-in-law: Dorothy and Vernon Christopherson of Green Bay; Elizabeth and John Pinkert of Green Bay; Rose Marie and Robert Hibbard of Wrightstown; George and I Karen Haen of Shiocton; Dale Christopher of West Allis; nieces, nephews and cousins. He was also preceded in death by four grandchildren: Nicholas and Alyssa Steeber; Aimee and Nathan Hopka; his mother-in-law and father-in-law: Marcella and George Haen; one brother: John Scheuer; two brothers-in-law: Edward Juckem and Albert Hansen; and one sister-in-law: Evelyn Christopher. Relatives and friends may call from 4 to 8 p.m .

on Wednesday at the Lambert Funeral Home in Mishicot. There will be a 7 p.m. parish wake service Wednesday evening at the funeral home. Visitation will continue after 10 a.m. on Thursday at the funeral home until leaving for the Mass of Christian Burial at 11 a.m .

at Holy Cross. Herald Times Reporter April 23, 2002 Reginald 'Rex' Rasmussen Reginald "Rex" Rasmussen, age 80, Denmark, passed away Monday, April 22, 2002 at a local hospital after a lengthy illness. Friends and family may call on Friday, April 26, 2002 from 4 to 8 p.m. at Knutson-Cotter Funeral Home, Denmark. Visitation will continue on Saturday directly at Our Savior's Lutheran Church, Denmark, Man allegedly punches through driver's window From staff reports MANITOWOC A 21- year-old Manitowoc man is facing charges as the result of a road rage incident that allegedly occurred Friday night .

Aaron King, 1311A Green was taken to the Manitowoc County Jail on a probation hold following the alleged incident. He currently is on probation for a previous battery conviction. King is being referred to the district attorney's office on new charges of criminal damage to property and disorderly conduct as a result of Friday's incident. About 11:30 p.m., police were called to a parking lot on Calumet Avenue to meet with a 17-year-old Two Rivers 1 man Accident and a passenger in his vehicle. They told officers they were stopped at a traffic light at South 21st and Washington streets, driving southbound, when a car pulled up next to them .

The Two Rivers man said he waved to the people in the other vehicle and then turned right and proceeded west 1 to Calumet Avenue and into the Park Plaza parking lot, followed by the other vehicle that was at the traffic light. King allegedly got out of the vehicle and approached the Two Rivers man and accused him of making an obscene gesture. King then allegedly struck the driver's side window, drove his fist through it and struck the Two Rivers man in the face, causing numerous cuts to his face. The other vehicle then drove off. victim ID'd Occupants were wearing seat belts From staff reports came airborne and struck a MANITOWOC The tree, coming to rest on its top .

Funeral service will be held at 10:30 a.m. Saturday at church with the Rev. Jay Kamrath officiating. Entombment will be in the Shrine of the Good Shepherd Mausoleum. Full obituary will be in Thursday's edition of this paper .

Herald Times Reporter April 23, 2002 A SPECIAL COMMUNITY GUN SAFETY DAY FREE GUNLOCKS TO BE DISTRIBUTED "Parent Power Love Jour Lock Jour Guns" Presented by: Two Rivers Police Department Saturday, May 4, 2002 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Aurora Medical Center, Two Rivers, WI In the United States, nearly 6,000 people under the age of 20 die of firearm related injuries. It has been estimated that of guns used in youth firearm suicides were obtained from the home of the victim, a relative or friend. According to firearm prevention effectiveness may be accomplished by utilizing safety devices in the form of a gunlock .

To learn more, attend this FREE community gun safety day that A gun safety presentation Gunlocks distributed FREE of charge The effectiveness of gunlocks Firearm prevention literature Crime Prevention Officers working with children regarding gun safety For more information, contact POLICE Lieutenant Gary Sheahan at 794-8866.
